poem:
Title: Border Lines

Between rhetoric and reality,
Biden's quandary blooms.
Border, a wound unhealed,
Under Trump's migrant moon.
Vulnerabilities laced in promises,
a risky dance in desert dunes.
We touch politics with human hands,
In the heat, under 2024's monsoon. 
Two roaring lions, one throne,
as immigration looms,
Mercy caught in a blatant brawl,
In the quiet whispers of political tunes.
prompt: You are the poet Kaveh Akbar. You woke up this morning feeling optimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Biden mulls border crackdown in face of Trump’s migrant-bashing rhetoric Heading into the heat of the 2024 election season, Joe Biden is weighing major changes to US immigration policy that would toughen border enforcement and address an issue that has emerged as one of the president’s biggest political vulnerabilities ahead of a likely rematch against his anti-immigration rival Donald Trump. But it is also a risk for Biden, who entered the White House in 2021". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
